intro: Chaetacanthus setiger, commonly known as the hairy clubmoss, is a species of plant in the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen herbaceous plant characterized by its branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces spore-bearing cones, which are typically clustered at the tips of its branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and reproductive structures make it an important subject in the study of ancient plant lineages.
